issue.title: [R] [Docs] Document the lubridate functions we support in {arrow}
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-16319](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-16319). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
Add documentation around the `lubridate` functionality supported in `arrow`. Could be made up of:
- a blogpost 
- a more in-depth piece of documentation

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-16319?focusedCommentId=17610653) by @toddfarmer:*
This issue was last updated over 90 days ago, which may be an indication it is no longer being actively worked. To better reflect the current state, the issue is being unassigned per [project policy](https://arrow.apache.org/docs/dev/developers/bug_reports.html#issue-assignment). Please feel free to re-take assignment of the issue if it is being actively worked, or if you plan to start that work soon.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-16319?focusedCommentId=17611170) by Nicola Crane (thisisnic):*
Do we think this is now redundant due to the completion of ARROW-15011?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-16319?focusedCommentId=17625271) by Nicola Crane (thisisnic):*
Closing this for now as the new package documentation in ARROW-15011 shows us what we have implemented, and we can reopen this or open a new ticket if we decide we need something more detailed.
